Sure, just send us the notification name so we can include it in the list of notifications to be converted to text.

Hi Sree,

Confirming we have made an update to the site. The message format for "Cancellation Form XML" is now text.
Let me know if this works for you.

action.text: Heath Maguire assigned to Joel Maligalig
Joel Maligalig assigned to Heath Maguire

full_threads.body:
Hi Heath,

Can this be actioned for any email that has a subject with XML, JSON or TXT?

I am looking at creating Forms for other parts of the organisation and I want to be able to create a notification called "XML <Form Name>" or "TXT <Form Name>" and have it send a text email.

A good example is the "XML Cancellation Request from Website" notification for the Cancellation Form.

If this is possible, then great. Otherwise, the above example is a good start.

Thanks.

Kind regards,

Sree Nair

IT Manager

1800 355 559

We can action this for you. Which forms and which notifications would you like this applied to?

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body:
Hi Team,

We are trying to perform some tasks with emails coming from the Pi-plus.com.au website. All the emails are coming as HTML.
Is there a way to send emails with the heading starting with "XML" or "JSON" to be plain text only from Gravity Forms? Unfortunately, Gravity Forms don't have any switch to make an email a text only or HTML email.

Thanks.



Kind regards,
